body:
@setu4993 - am I missing something obvious, or is this a bug?
Thanks

@yoshiya8 : Thanks for flagging. I don't think this is a problem at your end, I can reproduce it.

The backend correctly identifies and sets flags for the Okta / other social auth, but unfortunately, it cannot be used with the current version of the Doccano frontend.

What I had built was an integration with the previously used Doccano frontend (that is still under `app/server`). I can see that since https://github.com/doccano/doccano/commit/362df6373af833bb16ee02a4708db5a811f03d5c the frontend is being pointed to the new Nuxt.JS frontend. That version doesn't appear to have the ability to use the social auth and doesn't thus have all of the features that the old UI did. I am not familiar with Nuxt / Vue enough to be able to contribute the changes that'd be required, but if someone can point me to the file(s) that'd need to be touched, I'm happy to take a stab (cc @Hironsan, @icoxfog417).

Additionally, a workaround right now might be to build the Docker container from source, while checking out to an older commit. I tried building the container for 6e76b9586b9c95f27e9432a456f4213d2febef53 and got it to work. (One other change is required in `requirements.txt` there for it to build and run successfully: pin the max version of `pyjwt` as `pyjwt>=1.7.1,<2.0`).

The best I can tell, we need to port the login contained in lines 59-85 from [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/ea0590ad0bb32d2c91f9f27afd154829e13dcac4/app/server/templates/login.html#L59) to [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/frontend/components/auth/FormLogin.vue).

issue.title: [WIP] Add Google OAuth support

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: Attempt to resolve #620, with an approach similar to #675.

body:
+1 to this. Would love to be able to use OIDC on the new login.

The project since that older commit has a lot of improvements that I'd rather keep, and I'm also not familiar enough with Nuxt / Vue. If I have the bandwidth maybe I'll try to work on it in the future if it's not resolved by then.

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote ðŸ‘ related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show ðŸ‘ if someone upvote, and ðŸ¤© means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 ðŸ‘
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 ðŸ‘
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 ðŸ‘
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 ðŸ‘
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 ðŸ‘
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity

* Portability

### Dataset

* Import/Export

  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 ðŸ¤©

### Auto-Annotation

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 ðŸ‘

* Security

* Authentication

body:
Other important information for whoever works on this: while debugging it a bit myself, I noticed the templates in the Django app settings will also need modification: https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/app/app/settings.py#L90

Right now, it still redirects to old templates that require webpack installation and building.

+1, I'm facing this issue as well when trying to configure `OAuth Okta OpenID Connect`. 

@ljades 
> Other important information for whoever works on this: while debugging it a bit myself, I noticed the templates in the Django app settings will also need modification: https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/app/app/settings.py#L90
> Right now, it still redirects to old templates that require webpack installation and building.

I am guessing the issue this can be resolved by just changing [this line](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/app/app/settings.py#L93) to: 

`'DIRS': [path.join(BASE_DIR, '../../frontend/dist')],`

Not sure if there are additional places that will get affected by this change. ðŸ¤·
Same here. I am also not able to configure OIDC with Okta with v1.0.0 or v1.3.1 can someone help with that? Appreciate that!!

Hi @setu4993, I am having some trouble getting login with Okta working with version 1.0.0 or even with the version where you made the change and merged to master (commit: [68fdfb2](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/tree/68fdfb2b7be95d3e2dfdae07052c5c9243b5cac0) `Batch user save calls`). I followed the process outlined in this [document](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/advanced/oauth2_settings/) step by step but it did not seem to work. I might be missing something but I am not sure what it is. **Could you point me to a version of the project or commit where `Login with Okta` is working for you** (even if it is the old UI)? Appreciate your help in this regard. **What is the problem?** I am able to see the `Login with Okta` button when on the Old UI, when I click on it, I am being redirected to Okta once I enter my username and password correctly it gives me the following page: **Detailed Error Details:** ``` Environment: Request Method: GET Request URL: http://{doccano-url}/social/complete/okta-openidconnect/?code=xxxxxxxxxxxx&state=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx Django Version: 2.1.11 Python Version: 3.6.13 Installed Applications: ['whitenoise.runserver_nostatic', 'django.contrib.admin', 'django.contrib.auth', 'django.contrib.contenttypes', 'django.contrib.sessions', 'django.contrib.messages', 'django.contrib.staticfiles', 'server.apps.ServerConfig', 'api.apps.ApiConfig', 'widget_tweaks', 'rest_framework', 'rest_framework.authtoken', 'django_filters', 'social_django', 'polymorphic', 'webpack_loader', 'corsheaders', 'drf_yasg'] Installed Middleware: ('whitenoise.middleware.WhiteNoiseMiddleware', 'django.middleware.security.SecurityMiddleware', 'whitenoise.middleware.WhiteNoiseMiddleware', 'django.contrib.sessions.middleware.SessionMiddleware', 'django.middleware.common.CommonMiddleware', 'django.middleware.csrf.CsrfViewMiddleware', 'django.contrib.auth.middleware.AuthenticationMiddleware', 'django.contrib.messages.middleware.MessageMiddleware', 'django.middleware.clickjacking.XFrameOptionsMiddleware', 'social_django.middleware.SocialAuthExceptionMiddleware', 'applicationinsights.django.ApplicationInsightsMiddleware', 'corsheaders.middleware.CorsMiddleware') Traceback: File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py" in inner 34. response = get_response(request) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py" in _get_response 126. response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py" in _get_response 124. response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/views/decorators/cache.py" in _wrapped_view_func 44. response = view_func(request, *args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/views/decorators/csrf.py" in wrapped_view 54. return view_func(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/social_django/utils.py" in wrapper 49. return func(request, backend, *args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/social_django/views.py" in complete 33. *args, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/social_core/actions.py" in do_complete 73. social_user.provider) Exception Type: AttributeError at /social/complete/okta-openidconnect/ Exception Value: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'provider' ``` **Research:** I did do some research `['NoneType' object has no attribute 'provider'](https://stackoverflow.com/a/38895529)` and found that it could be the order of calls in the [settings.py#SOCIAL_AUTH_PIPELINE](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/v1.0.5/app/app/settings.py#L176-L190). I am not very familiar with Django and social auth, to be honest, so not sure what the right order is, it seemed correct to me when I looked at the documentation. Any suggestions? **PS:** I would rather prefer someone getting the login with okta working on the latest Doccano code version. But it is painful as it is not working in the older version as well. :(
Trying to tag/reach @setu4993 again (as he contributed the initial version of code) to see if he has seen this issue before/knows how to fix it.

Just an update. The below process works for me in case someone wants to use Okta OAuth with the old UI once you have cloned the repo (I just validated it):
1. `git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git`
2. `cd doccano`
2. `git checkout 6e76b9586b9c95f27e9432a456f4213d2febef53`
3. Update [line 33 in the requirements.txt at the root of the repo](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/6e76b9586b9c95f27e9432a456f4213d2febef53/requirements.txt#L33) from to: `pyjwt>=1.7.1,<2.0`
4. `docker build -t doccano-local .`
5. Depending on if you have OAuth2 or OIDC:
OAuth2:
```shell
docker run --interactive --tty \
    --env "SECRET_KEY=<SECRET_KEY" \
    --env "ADMIN_EMAIL=noreply@example.com" \
    --env "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" \
    --env "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OAUTH2_KEY=<OAUTH_KEY>" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OAUTH2_SECRET=<OAUTH_SECRET>" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OAUTH2_API_URL=<OAUTH_URL>" \
    --publish 8000:8000 \
    doccano-local
```

OIDC:
```shell
docker run --interactive --tty \
    --env "SECRET_KEY=<SECRET_KEY>" \
    --env "ADMIN_EMAIL=noreply@example.com" \
    --env "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" \
    --env "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_KEY=<OAUTH_KEY>" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_SECRET=<OAUTH_SECRET>" \
    --env "OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_API_URL=<OAUTH_URL>" \
    --publish 8000:8000 \
    doccano-local
```

Of course, this is not to say that the new UI should not support OAuth (it should!), but a detailed workaround for those that need it right now and are fine with the old UI.
